name: misgauge
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
to make a wrong judgment about something, especially people's feelings: We totally misgauged the amount of dissatisfaction with the system. It is not uncommon for people to misgauge their susceptibility to these biases. Related word
gauge verb (JUDGE)
More examplesFewer examplesThe agency misgauged what the markets were thinking.Senior executives had completely misgauged the direction in which the industry was moving. The report stated that the agency "badly misgauged" the financial meltdown.The acoustics of the hall had been misgauged by the artists, so that the piano was initially too loud.
